p: Of the total 648 samples collected from patients with ARI, 299 (46%), 314 (48%), 35 (5%) were collected during the first 3 days, 4–7 days and >7 days of symptoms onset respectively. About 52% (157) of the samples obtained during the first 3 days of symptoms onset were positive for one or more viruses ( Fig. 5 ). The viral positivity rate reduced by 9% if the samples were collected between 4 and 7 days of symptoms onset (P = 0.03) and 35%, if samples were collected after 7 days (P = 0.0002). Timing of sample collection and individual viral positivity is given in Fig. 6 .
